A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I was a bit afraid of Last Jedi just being a remake of Empire. It sure has its Empire moments and also some Return of the Jedi ones. But it has so many plot twists and emotional scenes that I am struggling in deciding if this is my favorite Star Wars movie of all time. 
I love the performances\, specially from Hamill and Ridley\, not to mention Carrie Fisher.
There is only one scene that I think went over the top and was so extreme that I do not think even the force justifies that. I do not want to give any spoiler but when you see it\, and you think of Mary Poppins\, then you know what I am talking about.
We lose one character before we get real answers\, but hell\, the movie had to be 3 hours to solve everything. Hopefully we get them in IX.
On the other hand\, this film has the most awing scene of all the franchise's flicks. So much that the sound is actually muted\, no special sound effects\, no dialog\, no epic music\, just the epic visuals and the emotional charge of it.
The movie lasts more than two and a half hours and I still was sad it ended. It kept me on the edge of my seat for the whole time.
